messages.subject: Re:satan movies was  being doable
messages.messageBody:
> I do have a big inner
> fear of the things real people can do.
>

<<Then beware of Frailty ~ it is a sick and twisted movie, and will not redeem
humanity for you. OTOH, I loved it ~ it was a great mind f*ck, reminiscent of
Silence of the Lambs. >>>

Well I should say I'm not oversensitive about it, just tends to be a VERY realistic subject with me and watching what I have I tend to be able to imagine a lot. I saw Silence of the Lambs too. I think I have more of a problem with the anticipation killer movies like Halloween where, through my eyes anyway, there isn't much of a plot.
I watch forensic shows and read and watch anything that is new on about serial killers. Just something I really want {or maybe it's need} to understand {as much as possible} but of course when you put yourself in the place of the victim it's a bit unsettling.
In the area of movies I tend to prefer comedies. :-b
Tracy

writes:

> No but {after looking it up on the web} I would most likely look to
> rent it. But I'd have to make sure I mentally prepaired myself for
> it first. There are many times I just can't watch that type of movie.
> I don't fear ghosts, spirits, or demons, but I do have a big inner

Fraility was very disturbing to me. It was good, I liked it because it was
thought provoking, but, it gave me the willies for sure. Watch it with someone
you feel safe with.

Teresa

messages.subject: Re:satan movies was  being doable
messages.msgSnippet: No but {after looking it up on the web} I would most likely look to rent it.  But I d have to make sure I mentally prepaired myself for it first. There are
messages.messageBody:
No but {after looking it up on the web} I would most likely look to
rent it. But I'd have to make sure I mentally prepaired myself for
it first. There are many times I just can't watch that type of movie.
I don't fear ghosts, spirits, or demons, but I do have a big inner
fear of the things real people can do.
As for movies like Halloween I don't watch them. But that's just me
<g>.
Tracy
